="preserve">The subset sum problem is an important problem of computer science. It can be stated as follows: Given a set of integers, does any subset of them sum to zero? For example, given the set, the answer is "yes" because the subset sums to zero. The problem is NP-Complete. It can be reformulated to the 3SAT.
An alternative statement of this problem is, given a set of numbers and an integer x determine whether or not there exist a subset that sums up to x.
Eg. given a set and x = 10 the answer is "yes" because sums to 10.
Remember that the subsequence need not to be contiguous. For instance if x = 8 in above example the answer is still yes because sums to 8.
